visits.text: Journey to Ambato crossing the central Andes
Discovery of Ambato's downtown and Cevallos park
Visit to Chimborazo volcano, Ecuador's highest peak
Hike in the Chimborazo Wildlife Reserve

activities.text: Visit to Casa de Montalvo and the Juan Montalvo museum
Vicuña observation and panoramic photography

visits.text: Exploration of Cotopaxi National Park, observation of the active volcano and Limpiopungo Lake.
Visit to Pailón del Diablo waterfall, impressive waterfall in the heart of the jungle.
Discovery of Machay and Manto de la Novia waterfalls along the waterfall route.
Second visit to Pailón del Diablo for another perspective of the waterfall.
Visit to the famous Swing at the End of the World, swing above the void.
Discovery of the waterfalls around Baños, including the famous Pailón del Diablo, accessible via a suspension bridge.
Climb to the Mirador de la Virgen for a view of Baños and the Tungurahua volcano.
Excursion to Baños and discovery of the waterfalls on the Waterfall Route
Walk to San Francisco Bridge and view of the Pastaza River

activities.text: Light hiking around the lake and spotting alpacas and condors.
Bike ride or buggy ride on the waterfall route.
Relaxation time at the thermal baths of Baños.
Thermal baths at the Baños de Agua Santa for a relaxing moment.
Tarabita ride above the gorges to admire the waterfalls.
Canyoning or zip-lining session in the Baños valley

visits.text: Long journey to Cuenca through the Andes mountain range, panoramic stops along the way.

activities.text: Quiet evening in the historic center of Cuenca.

visits.text: Exploration of Cajas National Park, hiking between glacial lakes and observation of Andean wildlife.
Discovery of Guayaquil's historic center and stroll along the Malecon 2000.
Climb to the colorful neighborhood of Las Peñas for a panoramic view of the city.
Journey to Guayaquil passing through subtropical valleys
Discovery of the colorful Las Peñas neighborhood and Malecón 2000
Visit to Parque Seminario (Iguana Park)
Discovery of the Museum of Anthropology and Contemporary Art

activities.text: Route to Guayaquil with stops at cacao plantations.
Relaxation on the banks of the Guayas River before departure.
Climb up Cerro Santa Ana to admire the city from El Faro
Cruise on the Guayas River or bike ride on Isla Santay
Giant tortoise observation in El Chato Reserve

visits.text: Route to the Cotopaxi region with stop at a traditional Andean hacienda.

activities.text: Walk on foot or horseback in the surrounding Andean landscapes.

days_plan.itin_title: ADVENTURES BETWEEN VOLCANOES, WATERFALLS AND JUNGLE – ROAD TRIP IN ECUADOR

visits.text: Visit to the Mariposario de Mindo to observe a wide variety of butterflies and local orchids.
Walk to the Nambillo waterfall by taking the tarabita (cable car) above the tropical forest.

activities.text: Swimming in the river at the foot of Nambillo waterfall.
Bird watching in the Mindo reserve, renowned for its hummingbirds and toucans.

days_plan.itin_title: FROM THE SIERRA TO THE JUNGLE: ADVENTURE ON THE ROADS OF ECUADOR

visits.text: Journey to Otavalo and visit of the famous artisan market, renowned for its colorful textiles and indigenous objects.
Hike around Cuicocha lagoon, formed in an ancient volcanic crater.
Discovery of Peguche waterfall, a sacred place for local communities.

activities.text: Walk around Lake San Pablo at the foot of Imbabura volcano.
Observation of weaving artisans from Otavalo in their workshops.

days_plan.itin_title: ADVENTURES BETWEEN VOLCANOES, WATERFALLS AND JUNGLE – ROAD TRIP IN ECUADOR
ADVENTURES BETWEEN VOLCANOES, WATERFALLS AND JUNGLE – ROAD TRIP IN ECUADOR

visits.text: Observation of Andean landscapes and páramo while ascending to the highlands.
Walk around the lagoons and tall grasses of the páramo.

activities.text: Relaxation at the Papallacta hot springs in natural outdoor hot water pools.

days_plan.itin_title: FROM THE SIERRA TO THE JUNGLE: ADVENTURE ON THE ROADS OF ECUADOR

visits.text: Flight Guayaquil – Galápagos Islands (Baltra) and transfer to Santa Cruz
Visit to the Charles Darwin Research Center
Boat excursion to Bartolomé Island to observe volcanic landscapes
Snorkeling with sea lions and tropical fish

activities.text: Walk on Tortuga Bay beach
Vol prochaine étape

visits.text: Discovery of the Amazon rainforest and Mirador Indichuris, overlooking the Pastaza River.
Walk to a secret waterfall in the jungle.

activities.text: Meeting with a local Kichwa community and introduction to their traditions.

visits.text: Hike around the crater of Quilotoa lagoon, famous for its turquoise waters.

activities.text: Optional descent to the lake shore and ascent by mule.

days_plan.itin_title: ADVENTURES BETWEEN VOLCANOES, WATERFALLS AND JUNGLE – ROAD TRIP IN ECUADOR

visits.text: Discovery of Quito's historic center, UNESCO World Heritage listed, including Plaza Grande, the cathedral and colonial streets.
Visit to the Basilica del Voto Nacional and climb the towers for a panoramic view.
Ascent to El Panecillo viewpoint to admire the Virgin statue and the view over the city.
Excursion to the Mitad del Mundo monument to put one foot in each hemisphere.
Exploration of the Pululahua geobotanical reserve, a unique inhabited crater in the world.
Discovery of the Museo Templo del Sol Pintor Ortega Maila, blending art and Andean culture.
TelefériQo cable car ascent up to 4000 meters for a spectacular view over Quito and Pichincha volcano.
Short hike on the Rucu Pichincha trail (weather permitting).
Discovery of Quito's historic center and the Basílica del Voto Nacional, with climb to the towers to admire the view.
Visit to the Mitad del Mundo monument to stand on the Equator line and discover ethnographic exhibitions.
Return to Quito via the scenic route and stop to taste the famous Helados Mickos.
Discovery of Quito's historic center, UNESCO World Heritage listed
Visit to Plaza de la Independencia and the Basilica del Voto Nacional
Excursion to Mitad del Mundo and the Intiñan museum on the equator line
Walk in La Carolina park and visit to the botanical garden
Full-day excursion to Cotopaxi volcano and hiking in the national park
Condor watching and Andean landscapes

activities.text: Evening stroll through the illuminated historic center.
Coffee break with view over the Pululahua crater.
Sunset observation from the summit.
Excursion to the Teleférico de Quito and hike on the Rucu Pichincha trail for a panoramic view of the capital.
Free walk through the artisan markets of Quito before departure.
Cable car ride on the TeleferiQo offering panoramic views of the city and Pichincha volcano
Typical Ecuadorian dinner and discovery of local cuisine
Guided visit to Quito's artisan market and discovery of local crafts
Lunch in a traditional hacienda

visits.text: Discovery of the town of Shell and the small museum dedicated to Nate Saint, pioneer of missionary aviation.
Visit to the local zoo near the military base to observe Amazonian fauna.

activities.text: Canoe excursion on the Río Napo from Puerto Misahuallí to reach a local community.
Swimming in a jungle river around Tena, typical experience of the Amazon basin.
